intro: Lapeirousia erythrantha var. welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch’s red orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and white petals. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
